means: Bioastronautical Orbiting Space Station 宇宙生物轨道空间站
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 博斯绰号，驼背，来源于古法语，含义是“驼背的”(hunchbacked)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都指"拥有权力或统治权的人"。
means: chief ： 最广泛用词，上可指最高统治者，下可指顶头上司，即可指任何一级的头头。
head ： 多指一个机构或团体等的负责人或最高首长。
leader ： 指国家、民族、政党、组织等的领导或领袖。强调领导能力、含有能够引导、指导、控制被领导者并获得其支持的意味。
boss ： 非正式用词，多作口语用，可指任何负责人，也可指经理、老板或工头。

word_mean: 圆凸，隆起：例如见于骨或肿瘤表面者

sentence.Network_en: The boss retains enormous influence by reason of his position.
sentence.Network_cn: 老板由于自身的地位而一直有极大的影响力。

sentence.Network_en: As the boss began to rant, I stood up and went out.
sentence.Network_cn: 老板开始咆哮的时候，我起身走了出去。

sentence.Network_en: He seemed to be in direct contact with the Boss.
sentence.Network_cn: 他似乎直接和老板联系。

jx.jx_en_mean: make it clear that it is oneself who is in charge
jx.jx_cn_mean: 让别人明白是自己说了算

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent. (originally US): from Dutch baas 'master'
Middle English : from Old French boce, of unknown origin

entry.def: Your boss is the person in charge of the organization or department where you work.

example.ex: Occasionally I have to go and ask the boss for a rise.
example.tran: 有时我不得不找老板要求加薪。

entry.def: If you are the boss in a group or relationship, you are the person who makes all the decisions.

entry.tran: 对…颐指气使；对…指手画脚
entry.def: If you say that someone bosses you, you mean that they keep telling you what to do in a way that is irritating.

example.ex: We cannot boss them into doing more...
example.tran: 我们不能再差遣他们做更多的事了。

example.ex: 'You are not to boss me!' she shouted.

entry.tran: 为自己打工；自己拿主意
entry.def: If you are your own boss, you work for yourself or make your own decisions and do not have anyone telling you what to do.

example.ex: I'm very much my own boss and no one interferes with what I do.
example.tran: 我自己很有主见，没有人干预我做的事。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who exercises control over workers;

sentences.sentence: "if you want to leave early you have to ask the foreman"

means.word_mean: 2. a person responsible for hiring workers;

sentences.sentence: "the boss hired three more men for the new job"

means.word_mean: 3. a person who exercises control and makes decisions;
4. a leader in a political party who controls votes and dictates appointments;

sentences.sentence: "party bosses have a reputation for corruption"

means.word_mean: 5. a circular rounded projection or protuberance

list.explanation: 工头或领班(尤指采矿作业班长)

example.zh: 采矿作业班的头儿就是领班。

Sentence.sentence: In 1955 Time's Man of the Year was Harlow Curtice, the boss of GM.
Times are so tough that even bosses are taking pay cuts.
Bosses have been summoned to Washington to be scolded on live television
You believe you have leadership abilities and your boss put you in charge of a new work team.
Report the matter to their boss.

I don't attend services when I am there, and I have never meditated, there or anywhere; I just take walks and read and lose myself in the stillness, recalling that it is only by stepping briefly away from my wife and bosses and friends that I will have anything useful to bring to them.

means.word_mean: 老板, 经理, 上司, 工头, 领班,总经理,领导

sentences.en: I asked my boss for a holiday.
Have you got a match, Boss?

jushi.english: I asked Boss for a holiday.
You can't let children just do what they like—You've got to show them who's boss!
jushi.chinese: 你不能让孩子想干什么就干什么,你得让他们知道谁是头儿。

jushi.english: My boss fired me without notice.
jushi.chinese: 我的老板没有事先通知就把我给解雇了。
